Subject: IEX - major update for a major oops!
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=115403844
X-Yahoo-Profile: jarrowwx

I can't believe I forgot that critical step...

And I told myself... "Don't forget to update the variable inputs inside the 
evaluation loop..."

But when I went in to add some code to weight the errors more heavily closer 
to the center and less towards the outside, I was quite amazed to find that 
the code for doing that wasn't there...I can't believe I did that!!!

So, the last 500+ generations are a total loss.  All it was learning to do 
is take the average of all the inputs.  Which it was definitely learning to 
do!  That's why it leveled out at 50%!  :)

Oh, yeah, turns out there was a major problem with my fitness sharing 
calculations, too.  That's fixed.

Anyway, so I'm back at square one.  But now I actually stand a chance of 
accomplishing what I set out to accomplish.  *sigh*

As for Colin and Ian, the auto-client-update code was still broken.  I fixed 
(and tested) it now, but it's too late for your copy.  Please update the 
client like so:

$ rm get_latest.sh
$ wget http://www.hanlonsrazor.com:81/neat/iex/iex_client/get_latest.sh
$ chmod 755 ./get_latest.sh
$ ./get_latest.sh
$ ./iex_client.sh

Thanks!  And thanks again for your donations of CPU time!

-- John
